alert.note: Alert for Otero (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 25 at 6:50AM MDT until June 26 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Colorado... Arkansas River At La Junta affecting Otero County. For the Lower Arkansas River...including La Junta...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Arkansas River At La Junta. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Minor Flood. Minor agricultural flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 11.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 AM MDT Sunday was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 9.2 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.4 feet on 06/27/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM MDT.
